<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Mediates between ELFNix initialization and ExecutionSession state.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/elfnixplatform"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight">ELFNixPlatform : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/platform">Platform</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Try to create a ELFNixPlatform instance, adding the ORC runtime to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// given JITDylib.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The ORC runtime requires access to a number of symbols in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// libc++. It is up to the caller to ensure that the required</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// symbols can be referenced by code added to PlatformJD. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// standard way to achieve this is to first attach dynamic library</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// search generators for either the given process, or for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// specific required libraries, to PlatformJD, then to create the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// platform instance:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\code&#123;.cpp&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   auto &amp;PlatformJD = ES.createBareJITDylib(&quot;stdlib&quot;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   PlatformJD.addGenerator(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     ExitOnErr(EPCDynamicLibrarySearchGenerator</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                 ::GetForTargetProcess(EPC)));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   ES.setPlatform(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     ExitOnErr(ELFNixPlatform::Create(ES, ObjLayer, EPC, PlatformJD,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                                     &quot;/path/to/orc/runtime&quot;)));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Alternatively, these symbols could be added to another JITDylib that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// PlatformJD links against.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Clients are also responsible for ensuring that any JIT&#39;d code that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// depends on runtime functions (including any code using TLV or static</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// destructors) can reference the runtime symbols. This is usually achieved</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// by linking any JITDylibs containing regular code against</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// PlatformJD.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// By default, ELFNixPlatform will add the set of aliases returned by the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// standardPlatformAliases function. This includes both required aliases</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// (e.g. &#95;&#95;cxa&#95;atexit -&gt; &#95;&#95;orc&#95;rt&#95;elf&#95;cxa&#95;atexit for static destructor</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// support), and optional aliases that provide JIT versions of common</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// functions (e.g. dlopen -&gt; &#95;&#95;orc&#95;rt&#95;elf&#95;jit&#95;dlopen). Clients can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// override these defaults by passing a non-None value for the</span></CodeLine>
